column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4650_165e0a5dc87f4b7cc52f5441a071f69c4b36226f/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

Maybe this is also related / can be removed now:

```
src/Makefile.am:AM_CPPFLAGS =  $(INCLUDES)
```

Some comments in src/m4 still refer to INCLUDES:

```
src/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4:dnl Requires: INCLUDES must be populated as necessary.
src/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4:dnl Requires: INCLUDES and LIBS must be populated as necessary.
src/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4:dnl Requires: INCLUDES and LIBS must be populated a

Mm, I'd rather eliminate the use of INCLUDES (now AM_CPPFLAGS) entirely. Since it was fairly straightforward, I went ahead and made the change. @kostaz Mind trying out https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/89d3cffffb28543e6bfa4aa59f4f33641190575f ?\n\nIt's a little wordy, but with the dependencies made explicit, moving the convenience libs to libtool libs (on my todo) will be simpler. It will a
@laanwj for the tests in the qt m4, those uses of INCLUDES and LIBS are necessary, as they have special meaning to the autoconf macros.\n
@theuni can you submit that as a pull request? I too prefer separating out the specific dependencies instead of lobbing them in to INCLUDES / AM_CPPFLAGS.\n
